properties.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 10 at 11:53AM PST until January 11 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* WHAT...Southwest to west winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 60
mph expected. Localized gusts to 70 mph around canyon openings.
Sierra crest ridges including Mammoth Mountain summit gusting
over 100 mph.

* WHERE...Mono County. Highest risk for wind impacts is along and
west of Highway 395 including Antelope Valley, Bridgeport, Lee
Vining, and near the Mammoth Airport.

* WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 4 PM PST Saturday. Peak winds
from Midnight to 10 AM Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Strong winds will blow around unsecured objects and
create hazardous conditions for high profile vehicles in the
Eastern Sierra. This includes Highway 395. Tree limbs could be
blown down and a few power outages may result. Severe turbulence
can also be expected.
properties.instruction:
Now is the time to secure loose outdoor items such as patio
furniture, holiday decorations (if you really still have those up),
and trash cans before winds increase which could blow these items
away. The best thing to do is prepare ahead of time by making
sure you have extra food and water on hand, flashlights with spare
batteries and/or candles in the event of a power outage.

NWSheadline: WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST SATURDAY
